member.name: T:NationalInstruments.UI.LineStep
member.summary: Specifies the style for connecting two consecutive points.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.UI.LineStep.None
member.summary: Points are connected with a straight line.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.UI.LineStep.XYStep
member.summary: Points are connected in an XY step. If the current point is represented as (x0, y0) and the next point is represented as (x1, y1), then a line from (x0, y0) to (x1, y0) and (x1, y0) to (x1, y1) represents an XY step.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.UI.LineStep.YXStep
member.summary: Points are connected in a YX step. If the current point is represented as (x0, y0) and the next point is represented as (x1, y1), then a line from (x0, y0) to (x0, y1) and (x0, y1) to (x1, y1) represents a YX step.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.UI.LineStep.CenteredXYStep
member.summary: Points are connected in an XY step with the x-coordinate centered on the line.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.UI.LineStep.CenteredYXStep
member.summary: Points are connected in a YX step with the y-coordinate centered on the line.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.UI.CursorSnapMode.Fixed
member.summary: The cursor can only be moved programmatically. The Cursor does not respond to the mouse. When it is moved programmatically, the cursor behaves as if the snap mode is set to Floating.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.UI.CursorSnapMode.Floating
member.summary: The cursor is set independent of any plot. You can move the cursor anywhere in the plot area.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.UI.CursorSnapMode.NearestPoint
member.summary: The cursor snaps to the nearest point on any plot. You can move the cursor along any plot.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.UI.CursorSnapMode.ToPlot
member.summary: The cursor snaps to the nearest point on the associated plot. The cursor can move only along this plot.

member.summary: Provides an abstract class that defines a set of methods used for generating error data for a ComplexPlot.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.UI.ComplexErrorDataMode.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the ComplexErrorDataMode class.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.UI.ComplexErrorDataMode.GetErrorData(NationalInstruments.UI.ComplexErrorDataArgs,System.Double[]@,System.Double[]@)
member.summary: Generates error data for a subset of the points in a ComplexPlot.
member.param: A ComplexErrorDataArgs instance containing information about the plot data points for which error data should be generated.
Upon return, contains high offset values for the plot data points, or an empty array if no error data was generated.
Upon return, contains low offset values for the plot data points, or an empty array if no error data was generated.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.UI.ComplexErrorDataMode.CreateNoneMode
member.summary: Returns a ComplexErrorDataMode that does not generate any error data.
member.returns: A ComplexErrorDataMode that does not generate any error data.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.UI.ComplexErrorDataMode.CreateConstantErrorMode(System.Double)
member.summary: Creates a ComplexErrorDataMode that generates symmetric constant error data.
member.param: The value to use for generating constant error data.
member.returns: A ComplexErrorDataMode that generates identical high and low constant error data according to symmetricOffset (parameter).

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.UI.ComplexErrorDataMode.CreateConstantErrorMode(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Creates a ComplexErrorDataMode that generates constant error data.
member.param: The value to use for generating high constant error data.
The value to use for generating low constant error data.
member.returns: A ComplexErrorDataMode that generates high and low constant error data according to highOffset (parameter) and lowOffset (parameter). The highOffset (parameter) is used to calculate error values that are greater than the data values specified in GetErrorData. lowOffset (parameter) is used to calculate error values that are less than the data values specified in GetErrorData. The primary error data specified in ComplexErrorDataArgs is typically used to specify whether the error values are being calculated for the real data or for the imaginary data.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.UI.ComplexErrorDataMode.CreatePercentErrorMode(System.Double)
member.summary: Creates a ComplexErrorDataMode that generates symmetric percent error data.
member.param: The value to use for generating percent error data. A value of 1.0 indicates 1% of the source value.
member.returns: A ComplexErrorDataMode that generates identical high and low percent error data according to symmetricOffset (parameter), and the primary error data of the ComplexErrorDataArgs passed to GetErrorData.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.UI.ComplexErrorDataMode.CreatePercentErrorMode(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Creates a ComplexErrorDataMode that generates percent error data.
member.param: The value to use for generating high percent error data. A value of 1.0 indicates 1% of the source value.
The value to use for generating low percent error data. A value of 1.0 indicates 1% of the source value.
member.returns: A ComplexErrorDataMode that generates high and low percent error data according to highOffset (parameter), lowOffset (parameter), and the primary error data of the ComplexErrorDataArgs passed to GetErrorData. The highOffset (parameter) is used to calculate error values that are greater than the data values specified in GetErrorData. lowOffset (parameter) is used to calculate error values that are less than the data values specified in GetErrorData. The primary error data specified in ComplexErrorDataArgs is typically used to specify whether the error values are being calculated for the real data or for the imaginary data.

member.summary: Converts a string representation of an arc to its Arc equivalent.

The string must be a string returned by ToString or a string in the following format: [float,float], where float is a valid float string and ',' is a culture-specific list separator symbol. The following strings are value (parameter) examples: "130, -30", "1.12e2, -1e2" and "Arc: StartAngle=10,SweepAngle=200".
member.returns: An Arc representing the arc specified in value (parameter).
member.exception: value (parameter) is not in [float, float] format or is not a string returned by ToString.

The following strings are value (parameter) examples: "130, -30", "1.12e2, -1e2" and "Arc: StartAngle=10,SweepAngle=200".
A format provider that supplies culture-specific formatting information about the string.
The culture to use for converting the string. If value (parameter) is a string returned by ToString, you must pass in the same CultureInfo object that you used with ToString.

Upon return, contains low offset values for the plot data points, or an empty array if no error data was generated.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.UI.XYErrorDataMode.CreateNoneMode
member.summary: Returns an XYErrorDataMode that does not generate any error data.
member.returns: An XYErrorDataMode that does not generate any error data.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.UI.XYErrorDataMode.CreateConstantErrorMode(System.Double)
member.summary: Creates an XYErrorDataMode that generates symmetric constant error data.
member.param: The value to use for generating constant error data.
member.returns: An XYErrorDataMode that generates identical high and low constant error data according to symmetricOffset (parameter).

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.UI.XYErrorDataMode.CreateConstantErrorMode(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Creates an XYErrorDataMode that generates constant error data.
member.param: The value to use for generating high constant error data.
The value to use for generating low constant error data.
member.returns: An XYErrorDataMode that generates high and low constant error data according to highOffset (parameter) and lowOffset (parameter). The highOffset (parameter) is used to calculate error values that are greater than the data values specified in GetErrorData. lowOffset (parameter) is used to calculate error values that are less than the data values specified in GetErrorData. The primary error data specified in XYErrorDataArgs is typically used to specify whether the error values are being calculated for the x data or for the y data.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.UI.XYErrorDataMode.CreatePercentErrorMode(System.Double)
member.summary: Creates an XYErrorDataMode that generates symmetric percent error data.
member.param: The value to use for generating percent error data. A value of 1.0 indicates 1% of the source value.
member.returns: An XYErrorDataMode that generates identical high and low percent error data according to symmetricOffset (parameter), and the primary error data of the ComplexErrorDataArgs passed to GetErrorData.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.UI.XYErrorDataMode.CreatePercentErrorMode(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Creates an XYErrorDataMode that generates percent error data.
member.param: The value to use for generating high percent error data. A value of 1.0 indicates 1% of the source value.
The value to use for generating low percent error data. A value of 1.0 indicates 1% of the source value.
member.returns: An XYErrorDataMode that generates high and low percent error data according to highOffset (parameter), lowOffset (parameter), and the primary error data of the XYErrorDataArgs passed to GetErrorData. The highOffset (parameter) is used to calculate error values that are greater than the data values specified in GetErrorData. lowOffset (parameter) is used to calculate error values that are less than the data values specified in GetErrorData. The primary error data specified in XYErrorDataArgs is typically used to specify whether the error values are being calculated for the x data or for the y data.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.UI.AxisMode
member.summary: Specifies the scaling mode of the specified axis.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.UI.AxisMode.Fixed
member.summary: The axis fixes the range to the existing range. The range is never updated.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.UI.AxisMode.AutoScaleLoose
member.summary: The axis automatically updates the range so that the range extends beyond the exact calculated data values.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.UI.AxisMode.AutoScaleExact
member.summary: The axis automatically updates the range to the exact calculated values.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.UI.AxisMode.ScopeChart
member.summary: The axis updates the range to behave as a scope chart. For example, if the existing range is 0 to 10 and a data value of 13 is plotted, the range is updated to 10 to 20.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.UI.AxisMode.StripChart
member.summary: The axis updates the range to behave as a strip chart by scrolling to the most recent data value. For example, if the existing range is 0 to 10 and a data value of 13 is plotted, the range is updated to 3 to 13.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.UI.AxisMode.AutoScaleVisibleLoose
member.summary: The axis automatically updates the range so that the range extends beyond the exact calculated data values for the subset of data in the range of the corresponding axis in the other dimension.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.UI.AxisMode.AutoScaleVisibleExact
member.summary: The axis automatically updates the range to the exact calculated values for the subset of data in the range of the corresponding axis in the other dimension.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.UI.Range.Parse(System.String)
member.summary: Converts the string representation of a range of values to its Range equivalent.
member.param: A string containing the range to convert. The string must be a string returned by ToString or a string in the following format: [ws]Double,[ws]Double[ws], where [ws] is an optional series of white space characters, Double is a parseable Double value, and ',' is a culture-specific list separator symbol. The following strings are value (parameter) examples: "0,10", "40,50", and "Range: Minimum=10,Maximum=100".
member.returns: A Range equivalent to the string specified in value (parameter).
member.exception:
value (parameter) is an empty string.
-or- value (parameter) is not in [ws]Double,[ws]Double[ws] format or is not a string returned by ToString.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.UI.Range.Parse(System.String,System.IFormatProvider,System.Globalization.CultureInfo)
member.summary: Converts the string representation of a range of values to its Range equivalent using the specified format and culture.
member.param: A string containing the range to convert. The string must be a string returned by ToString or a string in the following format: [ws]Double,[ws]Double[ws], where [ws] is an optional series of white space characters, Double is a parseable Double value, and ',' is a culture-specific list separator symbol. The following strings are value (parameter) examples: "0,10", "40,50", and "Range: Minimum=10,Maximum=100".
A format provider that supplies culture-specific formatting information about the string.
The culture to use for converting the string. If value (parameter) is a string returned by ToString, you must pass in the same CultureInfo object that you used with ToString.
member.returns: A Range equivalent to the string specified in value (parameter).
member.exception:
value (parameter) is null.
-or- formatProvider (parameter) is null.
-or- culture (parameter) is null.

value (parameter) is an empty string.
-or- value (parameter) is not in [ws]Double,[ws]Double[ws] format or is not a string returned by ToString.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.UI.NumericCoercionMode
member.summary: Provides an abstract base class for specifying the algorithm used to coerce a value and also provides a list of pre-defined coercion modes.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.UI.NumericCoercionMode.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the NumericCoercionMode class.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.UI.NumericCoercionMode.GetPreviousValue(NationalInstruments.UI.INumericControl,NationalInstruments.UI.NumericCoercionModeArgs)
member.summary: Gets the previous value in the sequence of coerced values.
member.param: An INumericControl implementation that specifies the context in which GetPreviousValue is called.
A NumericCoercionModeArgs that contains the coercion data.
member.returns:
A value representing the previous value in the sequence of coerced values.
When implementing a derived class of NumericCoercionMode, return the pervious value in the sequence of coerced values in your coercion mode. GetPreviousValue does not need to take into consideration the bounds of the valid range of values.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.UI.NumericCoercionMode.GetNextValue(NationalInstruments.UI.INumericControl,NationalInstruments.UI.NumericCoercionModeArgs)
member.summary: Gets the next value in the sequence of coerced values.
member.param: An INumericControl implementation that specifies the context in which GetNextValue is called.
A NumericCoercionModeArgs that contains the coercion data.
member.returns:
A value representing the next value in the sequence of coerced values.
When implementing a derived class of NumericCoercionMode, return the next value in the sequence of coerced values in your coercion mode. GetNextValue does not need to take into consideration the bounds of the valid range of values.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.UI.NumericCoercionMode.CoerceValue(NationalInstruments.UI.INumericControl,NationalInstruments.UI.NumericCoercionModeArgs)
member.summary: Coerces the specified value with respect to the specified context.
member.param: An INumericControl implementation that specifies the context in which CoerceValue is called.
A NumericCoercionModeArgs that contains the coercion data.
member.returns:
A value representing the result of applying the coercion to the specified value with respect to the specified context.
When implementing a derived class of NumericCoercionMode, return a value that is within the range of valid coerced values in your coercion mode.
